reasoning: The critique targets a potentially important moving part (trade/compromise as a route to mostly-great futures), but the original position already foregrounds value-destroying threats as a major obstacle that could wipe out gains from trade (sections 3.3–3.4), so it doesn’t substantially undermine the essay’s conclusions. It’s also just a single bare assertion with no supporting argument or specificity, so it provides very little refutational force. The claim itself is consistent with (and effectively endorsed by) the position, so it’s largely correct and very clear, with no dead weight, and it focuses on a single issue.
title: Value-destroying threats could eliminate most gains from trade
